title.narrative: SUPPORTING INDEPENDENT MONITORING

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, independent oversight and monitoring bodies, including CSOs, monitor the impact of relevant education, health and social welfare policies on the most disadvantaged children and use relevant findings to advocate for policy changes., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, Serbia's child rights infrastructure will be strengthened and civic and private engagement enhanced to realize children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, independent oversight and monitoring bodies, including CSOs, monitor the impact of relevant education, healthand social welfare policies on the most disadvantaged children and use relevant findings to advocate for policy changes.

Number of strategic child-focused reports produced by Republic Ombudsman Office that have been presented in public, communicated with decision-makers and have impact on improvements in policy and/or practice

baseline.value: 1 since the establishment of the Republic Ombudsman Office

target.value: 2015:2 reports per year with 50% of recommendations implemented

actual.value: 2015:1 general report issued for 2104 and submitted to the Parliament. Out of 91 recommendation for children, 83.72% are implemented. Ombudsman released 4 special reports related to children (asylum seekers, children in detention and victims of sexual violence, women victims of violence)

title.narrative: Number of public hearings on child rights related legislation

Civil society coalitions' monitoring and reporting on the impact of relevant policies and budget allocations in education, social welfare and health policies on the most disadvantaged children and use of findings for policy dialogue

target.value: 2015:At least one annual monitoring report published and used as an advocacy tool for dialogue with policy makers in order to influence policies and budget allocations

actual.value: 2015:MODS produced a position paper on inclusive education, Coalition of CSOs around Child Rights Center produced CRC shadow report, MODS produced Child Protection Index

title.narrative: Share of recommendations related to children based on citizens' complaints submitted to the Commissioner

target.value: 2015:10% of recommendations as an average across 5 years relate to children

actual.value: 2015:9 recommendations related to discrimination against children in 2014 equaling 19% (9 of 48). 8 opinions related to discrimination against children equaling 27% (8 of 30)
